I developed a robust understanding of Professor Ackerman's new theoretical framework for understanding and analyzing constitutional history. I also gained knowledge on the history of 20th century constitutions and their evolution, and developed a topic for my master's thesis.

The course worked well as a seminar, however, some additional reading in addition to Ackerman's text might have been helpful for developing a more robust conversation and debate. Professor Ackerman welcomed critiques of his theory, and his responses, whether to written submissions or in class contributions, were unflinching in dissecting their logical and substantial merit.
Strengths: originality of the class, discusssing with one of the leading scholars in the field
